page.title: 01Largs, Ayrshire
page.content: Main feature of this plot is the town of Largs overlooking the firth of clyde and Backed by hills up to 500m which are grazed by sheep and cattle. This town of 10,000 attracts fewer resident holidaymakers than of late but still attracts many day trippers. The firth, a major waterway, is sheltered and scenic and clyde cruising is popular, today only one paddle steamer remains but there are myriad smaller craft, other maritime connections include a marina, lifeboat, pilot boat, part time fishing boats and ferry connection to the holiday island of Cumbrae. Redundant tourist facilities are being converted to accomodation for the growing number of senior citizens who retire to Largs. This process has recently been accelerated by hefty rates increases.
